item.title: Dangerously long time on red at night/ early morning, 31st August
item.description:
The phasing of the lights changes after midnight til around 6am and the lights stay red coming from grange Road for an unusually long time which a) means you get cars beeping their horns b) makes people think the lights are out / stuck on red so they jump the lights into the always busy tower bridge road and c) pressures people to jump the red lights who have someone flashing or beeping behind them I see people in cars AND BUSES give up waiting and jump the lights nearly every time I have to stop at them during the change in phasing times - sometimes it’s red for over 10mins - it’s dangerous - please sort this out - thanks
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bermondsey Street, Old Kent Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish all over T-Green opposite 146 Wickham lane, 31st August
item.description:
The T-Green opposite 146 Wickham lane is full of litter, clothing etc. Please can a team be send out to help clean the area as it’s extremely dangerous for the environment, pets and kids. Many kids and dog walkers use the green daily and it’s become disgusting and unsafe to use. Thanks in advance.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rutherglen Road, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Extreme fruitfall from tree outside number 35, 31st August
item.description:

item.title: Fallen tree, 31st August
item.description:
Good afternoon, My neighbours tree has fallen into the road infringe of our house, blocking all access. I understand an emergency response has been contacted. My neighbour informed me he submitted an emergency application to complete works on the tree but the council refused. I would be keen to find out why I wasn’t informed that this tree was dangerous. My family drive and walk past the location everyday . The tree falling could have been a very serious incident and I’m told the council were aware. I look forward to hearing from you as a matter or urgency. Regards Sam Clouter
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Camden Way, Elmstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet
